definition: to leak (of air)/to go flat (of a tire)/to vent one's anger
to let go/to cast/to let loose/to discharge/to give expression to
to scatter/to sprinkle/to spill
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: Shirley stars search shu heart court clinic, angrily with his anger on servants in general.
sentences.chinese: 厲辰星搜索俞心庭診所未果，憤怒地拿底下人撒氣。

sentences.english: Don"t take your frustration out on me."
sentences.chinese: 別因爲今天你不順就拿我撒氣。

sentences.english: You're taking it out on her daughter.
sentences.chinese: 於是你現在就拿她的女兒來撒氣。

sentences.english: When the economic going gets tough9, people want someone to take their feelings out on10.
sentences.chinese: 每逢經濟不景氣，人們就想拿什麼人撒氣。

definition: to make fun of/to seek diversion
lit. small belly, chicken's gut (idiom); narrow-minded/petty
to drown sb in a wicker basket, a form of 沉潭[chen2 tan2]
to bite the hand that feeds one (idiom)
traitor to one's love/heartless rat
female gossip/busybody
narrow/petty-minded
annoying/disgusting
keenly felt pain/bitter anguish
crybaby
lit. either the fish dies or the net splits/a life and death struggle (idiom)
see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
son-in-law (used by wife's family)/uncle (husband of father's sister)
lit. rarely seen, very strange (idiom); to express amazement due to lack of experience/naive expression of excitement due to ignorance
bastard/scoundrel/rogue
foolish talk/nonsense
